July 26/1916
My Dear Wife:
div1.p:
I found Laura - here on my
Arrival Sunday morning. It has
been hot - & we have had too many
entertainments to be entirely comfor-
table. However there was nothing to do to-
day except - six calls this morning &
4 this afternoon,-& a meeting of the
”Incas“ - men who came down in 1904.

It has been pleasant to be made so much
of - which as been the case. Not only by
the higher officials - but by my old ins
inspectors; male nurses, three of my helpers
- all of
C1
B23
the old ones who are living & the minor
people generally. I knew all who knew
me & their names as well. Even “Amigo”
who used to ride up on the step of my car-
riage - came up to see me- He is 17 years
old now. & was about 7 when I knew him

I will have very much to tell you but
just now it is too much to write.
Tell Henry that every body he ever
worked with asked after him, every phy-
sician - from Velasquez to Bates - & all with
both respect & affection- & every nurse
of Ancon & Mrs Brakemeyer as S. To-
mas. Old Gargon (from Gorgona) especially
asked to be commended to him.

We leave in the morning & I am ra-
ther glad to get away- Although the Mag-
dalena, will be better than Panama.

We have to carry our own bedding etc. but do not
have
C1
B23
have to carry our own provisions & our
own Cook - as was the case a few years ago
The trip from Carthagena takes 9 days - the
last part of which is fairly high - & hence
in cool country. I must stop now &
pack for tomorrow- If I get a chance to
add a word, will do so

I found your very nice letter of July
1st here awaiting me
